subject: Self Care
title: The 90-Minute Cycle
description: A short lesson to help you apply The 90-Minute Cycle.

hook.text: Ever wake up after eight hours feeling awful but after six feeling great? Timing, not duration, was why.

buildup.text: Each sleep cycle lasts about 90 minutes. You pass through light, deep, and REM stages in sequence.

discovery.text: Waking at the end of a cycle feels natural. Waking in the middle of deep sleep causes grogginess.

twist.text: Sleeping 7.5 hours can feel better than 8 if 7.5 lands at a cycle's end and 8 falls mid-cycle.

climax.text: Count backward in 90-minute blocks from your wake time. Set your bedtime to match a complete cycle.

punchline.text: Sleep in full cycles. Wake up refreshed.

quiz.question: Why might 7.5 hours of sleep feel better than 8 hours?
options: 7.5 hours may align with the end of a 90-minute cycle
